labels.text:
Spring, Summer, Fall, and Winter are part of Richard Lin’s ‘White’ series, produced while living on the northwestern coast of Wales. Each painting is a square composition of horizontal bands of various shades of white, flatly painted against a white background, punctuated by
an occasional line break of faint primary colour. The works demand concentrated attention; each is related to and also distinct from the others. Lin’s extreme reduction of form to barely visible variations of white, producing stillness with little reference to the physical world save the titles, explores ideas of change in Taoist philosophy.
林壽宇「白色系列」中的《春》、《夏》、《秋》、《冬》，是他住在英國威爾斯西北岸時創作的作品。畫幅呈正方形，白色背景上的白色橫條，深淺不一、筆觸平順，偶有幾道淺淡的原色線條打破畫面的平靜。作品要求觀者全神貫注；各幅作品相互關聯，卻又不盡相同。林壽宇把造形極簡化，只剩下色差細微的各種白色，除了畫名，幾乎捨去任何與現實世界的牽扯，營造出平和寂靜的氛圍，亦反映出道家思想中應物變化之說。
